Plays > The Vow of Rokusuke

– Click image to view.

The Vow of Rokusuke

(彦山権現誓助剣) (Hikosan gongen chikai no sukedachi)

Written By: Umeno Shitakaze (梅野下風) , Chikamatsu Yasuzō (近松保蔵)

First Staged: 1786

Reference: Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 428, December 2000; Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku September 1975 Performance Program

Kashira:

Musume (娘)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Ōshūto (大舅)

Genta (源太)

Kōmei (孔明)

Kiichi (鬼一)

Koyaku (子役)

Masamune (正宗)

Bunshichi (文七)

Yokanbei (与勘平)

Kani (かに)

Ofuku (お福)

Chū koyaku (中子役)

Baba (jidai) (婆（時代）)

Takeuji (武氏)

Matahei (又平)

Oniwaka (鬼若)

Hagataki (端敵)

Hayaku (端役)

Baba (sewa) (婆（世話）)

Kodanshichi (小団七)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Onoemon (斧右衛門)

Wakaotoko (若男)

Otoko koyaku (男子役)

Yūsen (祐仙)

Baba (婆)

Performances:

September 1975: The Vow of Rokusuke

July 1982: The Vow of Rokusuke

January 1988: The Vow of Rokusuke

December 2000: The Vow of Rokusuke

Scenes:

Tachibana's Return (姫戻り)

The Glittering Mansion (金殿)

Kuzunoha's Parting with Her Son (葛の葉子別れ)

The Fox-Kuzunoha's Travel (蘭菊の乱れ)

The Inn at Ishibe (石部宿屋)

The Rokkakudo Temple (六角堂)

The Obi Shop (帯屋)

The Katsura River in a Dim Moonlight (道行朧の桂川)

The Imperial Palace (大内)

The Nunobiki Waterfall (布引滝)

Characters:

Yasaburo (衣川弥三郎)

Okiku (腰元お菊)

Mayumi (奥方真弓の方)

Rindayu, a Shinto priest (祝部山上倫太夫)

Mokusokan, in fact Shihoden (車騎将軍木曾官実は四方田但馬守)

Rokusuke (毛谷村六助)

Enami, a warrior (榎並一学)

Hayakawa, a warrior (早川兎毛)

Dengoemon (轟伝五右衛門)

Ichimisai (吉岡一味斎)

Yasamatsu (一子弥三松)

Tomohei (若党友平)

Yasazaemon (衣川弥三左衛門)

Takumi (京極内匠)

Tozo (春風藤蔵)

Otonari (郡大守音成)

Hisayoshi (真柴久吉)

Shingo Sakurai (桜井新吾)

Sasen (医者柴左仙)

Kotomi, a lady-in-waiting (腰元小富)

Omatsu, a lady-in-waiting (腰元お松)

Sannojo (弟三之丞)

Oko (母お幸)

Osono (娘お園)

Sagohei (若党佐吾平)

Page (小姓)

Low class samurai (青侍)

Kojika, a street girl (惣嫁小鹿(辻君お鹿))

Onoemon's mother (斧右衛門の母)

Gihei Kadowaki, a highway robber (門脇儀平)

Osen, a street girl (惣嫁(辻君)お仙)

Kikuno, a street girl (惣嫁(辻君)菊野)

Itachigawa, a sumo werestler (いたち川)

Pack-horse leader (馬丁)

Matsubei, a woodcutter (杣松兵衛)

Makizo, a woodcutter (杣槙蔵)

Kashiroku, a woodcutter (杣樫六)

Highway robber (山賊)

Soheiji, a retainer of Takumi (堀口曾平次)

Onoemon (杣斧右衛門)

Gunpachi, a retainer of Takumi (大坪軍八)

Ladies-in-waiting (腰元)

Kuriemon (杣栗右衛門)

Samurai (近習)

Assistant priests (下官)

Carpenters (大工)

Servants (奴)

Servants (組子)
